answer:
85-95% of infants immunized at 12-15 months of age with the measles, mumps, rubella (MMR) vaccine will develop antibodies. The MMR vaccine is scheduled at 12 months and 4-6 years of age. If you have specific concerns about you/your family and an exposure to a measles case, please contact your local health unit. Find the location near you here.
Immunization Nurse
question: I have a 13 month old who had his 12 month vaccinations last month. Given the recent measles cases, are you recommending bumping up the 2nd MMR vaccine ? I have read that a second dose can be given if more than 28 days has past between vaccinations.
question_variation_0: how many months between vaccines can you bump up second mmr vaccination
question_variation_1: should you bump up your mmr vaccine
question_variation_2: how soon between vaccinations can i bump my second dose
